title: As a self publisher, how can I get my books on Amazon and other like platforms? - Quora

response.answer_text: Each platform—Amazon, Barnes & Noble, Kobo, GooglePlay, Apple Books—have specific tools and step-by-step instructions on how to publish your books on their platforms. Amazon’s platform is called Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP for short). You can use free software tools provided by Amazon (such as Kindle Create) to convert your Microsoft Word-formatted file into a format for the Amazon Kindle, then answer a bunch of questions on formatting, distribution, pricing, etc., and then upload your file. It’s pretty straightforward. (They have an automated tool to make paperbacks, too.) There are also book amalgamators like Draft2Digital and PublishDrive where you upload a cover image and the Word document and they take care of all the uploading and converting (for 10% of your royalties). But my advice is—don’t just throw your book up there! You need to have a baseline of knowledge to do the right things so that your book meets reader expectations and gets to the right audience. There are loads of free podcasts and YouTube videos on how to do this properly. My favorites are The Creative Penn Podcast and Mark Dawson’s Self-Publishing Formula, and YouTuber Jenna Moreci has useful, hilarious, and profane 10-minute videos that can definitely help you figure out what process to follow to maximize your success. Even so, doing all the right things doesn’t guarantee success; the number of self-published books that make back their cost in editing, cover design, web hosting, advertising, and so forth are far outnumbered by those that don’t.

It depends on your target market. You can sign up on amazon kdp and go through their self publishing procedure. It is quite simple. You can go for an ebook or a paperback, which if approved will be published on amazon . Com, amazon . Co. Uk and various other extensions. If you want to target indian market specifically, know that the book will not be available on amazon. In. Your Indian readers will be able to purchase it through amazon. Com , but it won’t be affordable for everyone due to the high shipping cost. Therefore, to target the indian market, you can self publish your book at another site (eg: pothi .com) as well. Amazon. In and flipkart are a part of their distribution channel. If not through amazonkdp, you can search for local publishing companies in your region and discuss with them your requirements and expectations. There are various packages you can choose from, in case you are unaware of the procedure and want to seek expert guidance. If so, they will guide you with the further process and publish your book on the various ecommerce websites of the region or worldwide, based on your requirements. Hope that help! Happy publishing :)

response.answer_text: Publish through Kindle Direct Publishing (which is free and excellent), and your books will automatically be available on Amazon. Do not pay anyone to publish your books. Stay away from the vanity presses.
